Class ConfigCrypto

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class ConfigCrypto
extends Object
    Configuration encryption support

      • getInstance

        public static ConfigCrypto getInstance(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context,
                       ProviderListener providerListener)

      • getPropertiesToEncrypt

        public List<org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonPointer> getPropertiesToEncrypt(String pidOrFactory,
                                                                 String factoryAlias,
                                                                 org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonValue parsed)
                                                                   throws org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData
        Check each provider for meta-data for a given pid until the first match is found Requested each time configuration is changed so that meta data providers can handle additional plug-ins
        Parameters:
        pidOrFactory - the pid or factory pid
        factoryAlias - the alias of the factory configuration instance
        Returns:
        the list of properties to encrypt
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData

      • encrypt

        public Dictionary encrypt(String pidOrFactory,
                 String instanceAlias,
                 Dictionary config)
                   throws org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InvalidException,
                          org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InternalErrorException,
                          org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData
        Encrypt properties in the configuration if necessary Also results in pretty print formatting of the JSON configuration.
        Parameters:
        pidOrFactory - the PID of either the managed service; or for factory configuration the PID of the Managed Service Factory
        instanceAlias - null for plain managed service, or the subname (alias) for the managed factory configuration instance
        config - The OSGi configuration
        Returns:
        The configuration with any properties encrypted that a component's meta data marks as encrypted
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InvalidException - if the configuration was not valid JSON and could not be parsed
        org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InternalErrorException - if parsing or encryption failed for technical, possibly transient reasons
        org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData

      • encrypt

        public Dictionary encrypt(String pidOrFactory,
                 String instanceAlias,
                 Dictionary existingConfig,
                 org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonValue newConfig)
                   throws org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.openidm.metadata.WaitForMetaData

      • parse

        public org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonValue parse(Dictionary<String,Object> dict,
                                        String serviceName)
                                          throws org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InvalidException,
                                                 org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InternalErrorException
        Parse the OSGi configuration in JSON format
        Parameters:
        dict - the OSGi configuration
        serviceName - a name for the configuration getting parsed for logging purposes
        Returns:
        The parsed JSON structure
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InvalidException - if the configuration was not valid JSON and could not be parsed
        org.forgerock.openidm.config.enhanced.InternalErrorException - if parsing failed for technical, possibly transient reasons
